column6: Tax governance, control, and risk management
column13: REA Group manages its taxation affairs following the REA Group Tax Governance Policy, endorsed by REA's Audit, Risk and Compliance Committee (ARCC). REA Group's tax strategy is to support the business by adopting tax-effective positions that comply with tax law and are founded on sound commercial rationale.
column20: Tax Governance Policy, taxation affair, tax-effective position

column6: Stakeholder engagement and management of concerns related to tax
column7: REA Group engages with regulators, tax authorities, industry groups and external advisors in an ethical, transparent and professional manner in the countries where the business operates.
REA reports its international operations' tax contributions in controlling investments in India and its minority investments in the US and Southeast Asia.

column7: REA's scope 1 and 2 emissions in 2023 were 617.1 tCO2e.
REA's scope 1 and 2 emissions in 2023 were 617.1 tCO2e.
REA's scope 3 emissions in 2023 were 8,398.3 tCO2e.

column13: As part of REA's Climate Active carbon neutral certification, REA staples Biodiversity Units onto its Carbon Offsets to support local Australian Biodiversity projects. In FY22, REA's offsets supported the Crowes Lookout Biodiversity project, protecting 48 bird species and 7 threatened species on 6,168 m2 of projected land in Victoria's Otway Ranges.
column20: Carbon offset, carbon neutral, biodiversity project

column13: In FY23, REA Group engaged a sustainability consultancy to conduct a qualitative climate risk and opportunity assessment of REA Australia. The objective was to identify REA's most material climate risks and opportunities and complete qualitative analysis to understand how material transition and physical risks may evolve under at least two future climate scenarios for each type of risk.
column20: Climate risk and opportunity assessment, sustainability consultancy, qualitative analysis

column6: Nitrogen oxides (NOx), sulfur oxides (SOx), and other significant air emissions
Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts

column13: REA's Simply Cups helps employees separate coffee cups from other waste streams. Simply Cups collects the cups and collaborates with innovative technologies that give used cups a second life.
column20: Simply Cups, a coffee cup, waste stream

column13: REA's Melbourne HQ partners with Reground, a social enterprise promoting a circular economy through waste collection and minimisation projects. In February 2023, Reground conducted an education session discussing their processes and the challenges of recycling soft plastics in Australia. Reground emphasised the contamination issue in the collected bins and advised on steps to improve recycling practices.
